00035 /******************************** Quaternions ********************************/
00036 
00037 /* used to test is a quat is not normalized */
00038 #define QUAT_EPSILON 0.0001
00039 
00040 /* convenience, avoids setting Y axis everywhere */
00041 void unit_axis_angle(float axis[3], float *angle)
00042 {
00043     axis[0] = 0.0f;
00044     axis[1] = 1.0f;
00045     axis[2] = 0.0f;
00046     *angle = 0.0f;
00047 }
00048 
00049 void unit_qt(float q[4])
00050 {
00051     q[0] = 1.0f;
00052     q[1] = q[2] = q[3] = 0.0f;
00053 }
00054 
00055 void copy_qt_qt(float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00056 {
00057     q1[0] = q2[0];
00058     q1[1] = q2[1];
00059     q1[2] = q2[2];
00060     q1[3] = q2[3];
00061 }
00062 
00063 int is_zero_qt(float *q)
00064 {
00065     return (q[0] == 0 && q[1] == 0 && q[2] == 0 && q[3] == 0);
00066 }
00067 
00068 void mul_qt_qtqt(float q[4], const float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00069 {
00070     float t0, t1, t2;
00071 
00072     t0 = q1[0] * q2[0] - q1[1] * q2[1] - q1[2] * q2[2] - q1[3] * q2[3];
00073     t1 = q1[0] * q2[1] + q1[1] * q2[0] + q1[2] * q2[3] - q1[3] * q2[2];
00074     t2 = q1[0] * q2[2] + q1[2] * q2[0] + q1[3] * q2[1] - q1[1] * q2[3];
00075     q[3] = q1[0] * q2[3] + q1[3] * q2[0] + q1[1] * q2[2] - q1[2] * q2[1];
00076     q[0] = t0;
00077     q[1] = t1;
00078     q[2] = t2;
00079 }
00080 
00081 /* Assumes a unit quaternion */
00082 void mul_qt_v3(const float q[4], float v[3])
00083 {
00084     float t0, t1, t2;
00085 
00086     t0 = -q[1] * v[0] - q[2] * v[1] - q[3] * v[2];
00087     t1 = q[0] * v[0] + q[2] * v[2] - q[3] * v[1];
00088     t2 = q[0] * v[1] + q[3] * v[0] - q[1] * v[2];
00089     v[2] = q[0] * v[2] + q[1] * v[1] - q[2] * v[0];
00090     v[0] = t1;
00091     v[1] = t2;
00092 
00093     t1 = t0 * -q[1] + v[0] * q[0] - v[1] * q[3] + v[2] * q[2];
00094     t2 = t0 * -q[2] + v[1] * q[0] - v[2] * q[1] + v[0] * q[3];
00095     v[2] = t0 * -q[3] + v[2] * q[0] - v[0] * q[2] + v[1] * q[1];
00096     v[0] = t1;
00097     v[1] = t2;
00098 }
00099 
00100 void conjugate_qt(float q[4])
00101 {
00102     q[1] = -q[1];
00103     q[2] = -q[2];
00104     q[3] = -q[3];
00105 }
00106 
00107 float dot_qtqt(const float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00108 {
00109     return q1[0] * q2[0] + q1[1] * q2[1] + q1[2] * q2[2] + q1[3] * q2[3];
00110 }
00111 
00112 void invert_qt(float q[4])
00113 {
00114     float f = dot_qtqt(q, q);
00115 
00116     if (f == 0.0f)
00117         return;
00118 
00119     conjugate_qt(q);
00120     mul_qt_fl(q, 1.0f / f);
00121 }
00122 
00123 void invert_qt_qt(float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00124 {
00125     copy_qt_qt(q1, q2);
00126     invert_qt(q1);
00127 }
00128 
00129 /* simple mult */
00130 void mul_qt_fl(float q[4], const float f)
00131 {
00132     q[0] *= f;
00133     q[1] *= f;
00134     q[2] *= f;
00135     q[3] *= f;
00136 }
00137 
00138 void sub_qt_qtqt(float q[4], const float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00139 {
00140     float nq2[4];
00141 
00142     nq2[0] = -q2[0];
00143     nq2[1] = q2[1];
00144     nq2[2] = q2[2];
00145     nq2[3] = q2[3];
00146 
00147     mul_qt_qtqt(q, q1, nq2);
00148 }
00149 
00150 /* angular mult factor */
00151 void mul_fac_qt_fl(float q[4], const float fac)
00152 {
00153     float angle = fac * saacos(q[0]); /* quat[0] = cos(0.5 * angle), but now the 0.5 and 2.0 rule out */
00154 
00155     float co = (float)cos(angle);
00156     float si = (float)sin(angle);
00157     q[0] = co;
00158     normalize_v3(q + 1);
00159     mul_v3_fl(q + 1, si);
00160 }

00162 /* skip error check, currently only needed by mat3_to_quat_is_ok */
00163 static void quat_to_mat3_no_error(float m[][3], const float q[4])
00164 {
00165     double q0, q1, q2, q3, qda, qdb, qdc, qaa, qab, qac, qbb, qbc, qcc;
00166 
00167     q0 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[0];
00168     q1 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[1];
00169     q2 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[2];
00170     q3 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[3];
00171 
00172     qda = q0 * q1;
00173     qdb = q0 * q2;
00174     qdc = q0 * q3;
00175     qaa = q1 * q1;
00176     qab = q1 * q2;
00177     qac = q1 * q3;
00178     qbb = q2 * q2;
00179     qbc = q2 * q3;
00180     qcc = q3 * q3;
00181 
00182     m[0][0] = (float)(1.0 - qbb - qcc);
00183     m[0][1] = (float)(qdc + qab);
00184     m[0][2] = (float)(-qdb + qac);
00185 
00186     m[1][0] = (float)(-qdc + qab);
00187     m[1][1] = (float)(1.0 - qaa - qcc);
00188     m[1][2] = (float)(qda + qbc);
00189 
00190     m[2][0] = (float)(qdb + qac);
00191     m[2][1] = (float)(-qda + qbc);
00192     m[2][2] = (float)(1.0 - qaa - qbb);
00193 }
00194 
00195 void quat_to_mat3(float m[][3], const float q[4])
00196 {
00197 #ifdef DEBUG
00198     float f;
00199     if (!((f = dot_qtqt(q, q)) == 0.0f || (fabsf(f - 1.0f) < (float)QUAT_EPSILON))) {
00200         fprintf(stderr, "Warning! quat_to_mat3() called with non-normalized: size %.8f *** report a bug ***\n", f);
00201     }
00202 #endif
00203 
00204     quat_to_mat3_no_error(m, q);
00205 }
00206 
00207 void quat_to_mat4(float m[][4], const float q[4])
00208 {
00209     double q0, q1, q2, q3, qda, qdb, qdc, qaa, qab, qac, qbb, qbc, qcc;
00210 
00211 #ifdef DEBUG
00212     if (!((q0 = dot_qtqt(q, q)) == 0.0f || (fabsf(q0 - 1.0) < QUAT_EPSILON))) {
00213         fprintf(stderr, "Warning! quat_to_mat4() called with non-normalized: size %.8f *** report a bug ***\n", (float)q0);
00214     }
00215 #endif
00216 
00217     q0 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[0];
00218     q1 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[1];
00219     q2 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[2];
00220     q3 = M_SQRT2 * (double)q[3];
00221 
00222     qda = q0 * q1;
00223     qdb = q0 * q2;
00224     qdc = q0 * q3;
00225     qaa = q1 * q1;
00226     qab = q1 * q2;
00227     qac = q1 * q3;
00228     qbb = q2 * q2;
00229     qbc = q2 * q3;
00230     qcc = q3 * q3;
00231 
00232     m[0][0] = (float)(1.0 - qbb - qcc);
00233     m[0][1] = (float)(qdc + qab);
00234     m[0][2] = (float)(-qdb + qac);
00235     m[0][3] = 0.0f;
00236 
00237     m[1][0] = (float)(-qdc + qab);
00238     m[1][1] = (float)(1.0 - qaa - qcc);
00239     m[1][2] = (float)(qda + qbc);
00240     m[1][3] = 0.0f;
00241 
00242     m[2][0] = (float)(qdb + qac);
00243     m[2][1] = (float)(-qda + qbc);
00244     m[2][2] = (float)(1.0 - qaa - qbb);
00245     m[2][3] = 0.0f;
00246 
00247     m[3][0] = m[3][1] = m[3][2] = 0.0f;
00248     m[3][3] = 1.0f;
00249 }
00250 
00251 void mat3_to_quat(float q[4], float wmat[][3])
00252 {
00253     double tr, s;
00254     float mat[3][3];
00255 
00256     /* work on a copy */
00257     copy_m3_m3(mat, wmat);
00258     normalize_m3(mat); /* this is needed AND a 'normalize_qt' in the end */
00259 
00260     tr = 0.25 * (double)(1.0f + mat[0][0] + mat[1][1] + mat[2][2]);
00261 
00262     if (tr > (double)FLT_EPSILON) {
00263         s = sqrt(tr);
00264         q[0] = (float)s;
00265         s = 1.0 / (4.0 * s);
00266         q[1] = (float)((mat[1][2] - mat[2][1]) * s);
00267         q[2] = (float)((mat[2][0] - mat[0][2]) * s);
00268         q[3] = (float)((mat[0][1] - mat[1][0]) * s);
00269     }
00270     else {
00271         if (mat[0][0] > mat[1][1] && mat[0][0] > mat[2][2]) {
00272             s = 2.0f * sqrtf(1.0f + mat[0][0] - mat[1][1] - mat[2][2]);
00273             q[1] = (float)(0.25 * s);
00274 
00275             s = 1.0 / s;
00276             q[0] = (float)((double)(mat[2][1] - mat[1][2]) * s);
00277             q[2] = (float)((double)(mat[1][0] + mat[0][1]) * s);
00278             q[3] = (float)((double)(mat[2][0] + mat[0][2]) * s);
00279         }
00280         else if (mat[1][1] > mat[2][2]) {
00281             s = 2.0f * sqrtf(1.0f + mat[1][1] - mat[0][0] - mat[2][2]);
00282             q[2] = (float)(0.25 * s);
00283 
00284             s = 1.0 / s;
00285             q[0] = (float)((double)(mat[2][0] - mat[0][2]) * s);
00286             q[1] = (float)((double)(mat[1][0] + mat[0][1]) * s);
00287             q[3] = (float)((double)(mat[2][1] + mat[1][2]) * s);
00288         }
00289         else {
00290             s = 2.0f * sqrtf(1.0f + mat[2][2] - mat[0][0] - mat[1][1]);
00291             q[3] = (float)(0.25 * s);
00292 
00293             s = 1.0 / s;
00294             q[0] = (float)((double)(mat[1][0] - mat[0][1]) * s);
00295             q[1] = (float)((double)(mat[2][0] + mat[0][2]) * s);
00296             q[2] = (float)((double)(mat[2][1] + mat[1][2]) * s);
00297         }
00298     }
00299 
00300     normalize_qt(q);
00301 }
00302 
00303 void mat4_to_quat(float q[4], float m[][4])
00304 {
00305     float mat[3][3];
00306 
00307     copy_m3_m4(mat, m);
00308     mat3_to_quat(q, mat);
00309 }
00310 
00311 void mat3_to_quat_is_ok(float q[4], float wmat[3][3])
00312 {
00313     float mat[3][3], matr[3][3], matn[3][3], q1[4], q2[4], angle, si, co, nor[3];
00314 
00315     /* work on a copy */
00316     copy_m3_m3(mat, wmat);
00317     normalize_m3(mat);
00318 
00319     /* rotate z-axis of matrix to z-axis */
00320 
00321     nor[0] = mat[2][1]; /* cross product with (0,0,1) */
00322     nor[1] = -mat[2][0];
00323     nor[2] = 0.0;
00324     normalize_v3(nor);
00325 
00326     co = mat[2][2];
00327     angle = 0.5f * saacos(co);
00328 
00329     co = (float)cos(angle);
00330     si = (float)sin(angle);
00331     q1[0] = co;
00332     q1[1] = -nor[0] * si; /* negative here, but why? */
00333     q1[2] = -nor[1] * si;
00334     q1[3] = -nor[2] * si;
00335 
00336     /* rotate back x-axis from mat, using inverse q1 */
00337     quat_to_mat3_no_error(matr, q1);
00338     invert_m3_m3(matn, matr);
00339     mul_m3_v3(matn, mat[0]);
00340 
00341     /* and align x-axes */
00342     angle = (float)(0.5 * atan2(mat[0][1], mat[0][0]));
00343 
00344     co = (float)cos(angle);
00345     si = (float)sin(angle);
00346     q2[0] = co;
00347     q2[1] = 0.0f;
00348     q2[2] = 0.0f;
00349     q2[3] = si;
00350 
00351     mul_qt_qtqt(q, q1, q2);
00352 }
00353 
00354 float normalize_qt(float q[4])
00355 {
00356     float len;
00357 
00358     len = (float)sqrt(dot_qtqt(q, q));
00359     if (len != 0.0f) {
00360         mul_qt_fl(q, 1.0f / len);
00361     }
00362     else {
00363         q[1] = 1.0f;
00364         q[0] = q[2] = q[3] = 0.0f;
00365     }
00366 
00367     return len;
00368 }
00369 
00370 float normalize_qt_qt(float r[4], const float q[4])
00371 {
00372     copy_qt_qt(r, q);
00373     return normalize_qt(r);
00374 }

00376 /* note: expects vectors to be normalized */
00377 void rotation_between_vecs_to_quat(float q[4], const float v1[3], const float v2[3])
00378 {
00379     float axis[3];
00380     float angle;
00381 
00382     cross_v3_v3v3(axis, v1, v2);
00383 
00384     angle = angle_normalized_v3v3(v1, v2);
00385 
00386     axis_angle_to_quat(q, axis, angle);
00387 }
00388 
00389 void rotation_between_quats_to_quat(float q[4], const float q1[4], const float q2[4])
00390 {
00391     float tquat[4];
00392     double dot = 0.0f;
00393     int x;
00394 
00395     copy_qt_qt(tquat, q1);
00396     conjugate_qt(tquat);
00397     dot = 1.0f / dot_qtqt(tquat, tquat);
00398 
00399     for (x = 0; x < 4; x++)
00400         tquat[x] *= dot;
00401 
00402     mul_qt_qtqt(q, tquat, q2);
00403 }
00404 
00405 void vec_to_quat(float q[4], const float vec[3], short axis, const short upflag)
00406 {
00407     float q2[4], nor[3], *fp, mat[3][3], angle, si, co, x2, y2, z2, len1;
00408 
00409     assert(axis >= 0 && axis <= 5);
00410     assert(upflag >= 0 && upflag <= 2);
00411 
00412     /* first rotate to axis */
00413     if (axis > 2) {
00414         x2 = vec[0];
00415         y2 = vec[1];
00416         z2 = vec[2];
00417         axis -= 3;
00418     }
00419     else {
00420         x2 = -vec[0];
00421         y2 = -vec[1];
00422         z2 = -vec[2];
00423     }
00424 
00425     q[0] = 1.0;
00426     q[1] = q[2] = q[3] = 0.0;
00427 
00428     len1 = (float)sqrt(x2 * x2 + y2 * y2 + z2 * z2);
00429     if (len1 == 0.0f) return;
00430 
00431     /* nasty! I need a good routine for this...
00432      * problem is a rotation of an Y axis to the negative Y-axis for example.
00433      */
00434 
00435     if (axis == 0) { /* x-axis */
00436         nor[0] = 0.0;
00437         nor[1] = -z2;
00438         nor[2] = y2;
00439 
00440         if (fabs(y2) + fabs(z2) < 0.0001)
00441             nor[1] = 1.0;
00442 
00443         co = x2;
00444     }
00445     else if (axis == 1) { /* y-axis */
00446         nor[0] = z2;
00447         nor[1] = 0.0;
00448         nor[2] = -x2;
00449 
00450         if (fabs(x2) + fabs(z2) < 0.0001)
00451             nor[2] = 1.0;
00452 
00453         co = y2;
00454     }
00455     else { /* z-axis */
00456         nor[0] = -y2;
00457         nor[1] = x2;
00458         nor[2] = 0.0;
00459 
00460         if (fabs(x2) + fabs(y2) < 0.0001)
00461             nor[0] = 1.0;
00462 
00463         co = z2;
00464     }
00465     co /= len1;
00466 
00467     normalize_v3(nor);
00468 
00469     angle = 0.5f * saacos(co);
00470     si = (float)sin(angle);
00471     q[0] = (float)cos(angle);
00472     q[1] = nor[0] * si;
00473     q[2] = nor[1] * si;
00474     q[3] = nor[2] * si;
00475 
00476     if (axis != upflag) {
00477         quat_to_mat3(mat, q);
00478 
00479         fp = mat[2];
00480         if (axis == 0) {
00481             if (upflag == 1) angle = (float)(0.5 * atan2(fp[2], fp[1]));
00482             else angle = (float)(-0.5 * atan2(fp[1], fp[2]));
00483         }
00484         else if (axis == 1) {
00485             if (upflag == 0) angle = (float)(-0.5 * atan2(fp[2], fp[0]));
00486             else angle = (float)(0.5 * atan2(fp[0], fp[2]));
00487         }
00488         else {
00489             if (upflag == 0) angle = (float)(0.5 * atan2(-fp[1], -fp[0]));
00490             else angle = (float)(-0.5 * atan2(-fp[0], -fp[1]));
00491         }
00492 
00493         co = cosf(angle);
00494         si = sinf(angle) / len1;
00495         q2[0] = co;
00496         q2[1] = x2 * si;
00497         q2[2] = y2 * si;
00498         q2[3] = z2 * si;
00499 
00500         mul_qt_qtqt(q, q2, q);
00501     }
00502 }

00504 #if 0
00505 
00506 /* A & M Watt, Advanced animation and rendering techniques, 1992 ACM press */
00507 void QuatInterpolW(float *result, float quat1[4], float quat2[4], float t)
00508 {
00509     float omega, cosom, sinom, sc1, sc2;
00510 
00511     cosom = quat1[0] * quat2[0] + quat1[1] * quat2[1] + quat1[2] * quat2[2] + quat1[3] * quat2[3];
00512 
00513     /* rotate around shortest angle */
00514     if ((1.0f + cosom) > 0.0001f) {
00515 
00516         if ((1.0f - cosom) > 0.0001f) {
00517             omega = (float)acos(cosom);
00518             sinom = (float)sin(omega);
00519             sc1 = (float)sin((1.0 - t) * omega) / sinom;
00520             sc2 = (float)sin(t * omega) / sinom;
00521         }
00522         else {
00523             sc1 = 1.0f - t;
00524             sc2 = t;
00525         }
00526         result[0] = sc1 * quat1[0] + sc2 * quat2[0];
00527         result[1] = sc1 * quat1[1] + sc2 * quat2[1];
00528         result[2] = sc1 * quat1[2] + sc2 * quat2[2];
00529         result[3] = sc1 * quat1[3] + sc2 * quat2[3];
00530     }
00531     else {
00532         result[0] = quat2[3];
00533         result[1] = -quat2[2];
00534         result[2] = quat2[1];
00535         result[3] = -quat2[0];
00536 
00537         sc1 = (float)sin((1.0 - t) * M_PI_2);
00538         sc2 = (float)sin(t * M_PI_2);
00539 
00540         result[0] = sc1 * quat1[0] + sc2 * result[0];
00541         result[1] = sc1 * quat1[1] + sc2 * result[1];
00542         result[2] = sc1 * quat1[2] + sc2 * result[2];
00543         result[3] = sc1 * quat1[3] + sc2 * result[3];
00544     }
00545 }
00546 #endif
00547 
00548 void interp_qt_qtqt(float result[4], const float quat1[4], const float quat2[4], const float t)
00549 {
00550     float quat[4], omega, cosom, sinom, sc1, sc2;
00551 
00552     cosom = quat1[0] * quat2[0] + quat1[1] * quat2[1] + quat1[2] * quat2[2] + quat1[3] * quat2[3];
00553 
00554     /* rotate around shortest angle */
00555     if (cosom < 0.0f) {
00556         cosom = -cosom;
00557         quat[0] = -quat1[0];
00558         quat[1] = -quat1[1];
00559         quat[2] = -quat1[2];
00560         quat[3] = -quat1[3];
00561     }
00562     else {
00563         quat[0] = quat1[0];
00564         quat[1] = quat1[1];
00565         quat[2] = quat1[2];
00566         quat[3] = quat1[3];
00567     }
00568 
00569     if ((1.0f - cosom) > 0.0001f) {
00570         omega = (float)acos(cosom);
00571         sinom = (float)sin(omega);
00572         sc1 = (float)sin((1 - t) * omega) / sinom;
00573         sc2 = (float)sin(t * omega) / sinom;
00574     }
00575     else {
00576         sc1 = 1.0f - t;
00577         sc2 = t;
00578     }
00579 
00580     result[0] = sc1 * quat[0] + sc2 * quat2[0];
00581     result[1] = sc1 * quat[1] + sc2 * quat2[1];
00582     result[2] = sc1 * quat[2] + sc2 * quat2[2];
00583     result[3] = sc1 * quat[3] + sc2 * quat2[3];
00584 }
00585 
00586 void add_qt_qtqt(float result[4], const float quat1[4], const float quat2[4], const float t)
00587 {
00588     result[0] = quat1[0] + t * quat2[0];
00589     result[1] = quat1[1] + t * quat2[1];
00590     result[2] = quat1[2] + t * quat2[2];
00591     result[3] = quat1[3] + t * quat2[3];
00592 }
00593 
00594 void tri_to_quat(float quat[4], const float v1[3], const float v2[3], const float v3[3])
00595 {
00596     /* imaginary x-axis, y-axis triangle is being rotated */
00597     float vec[3], q1[4], q2[4], n[3], si, co, angle, mat[3][3], imat[3][3];
00598 
00599     /* move z-axis to face-normal */
00600     normal_tri_v3(vec, v1, v2, v3);
00601 
00602     n[0] = vec[1];
00603     n[1] = -vec[0];
00604     n[2] = 0.0f;
00605     normalize_v3(n);
00606 
00607     if (n[0] == 0.0f && n[1] == 0.0f) n[0] = 1.0f;
00608 
00609     angle = -0.5f * (float)saacos(vec[2]);
00610     co = (float)cos(angle);
00611     si = (float)sin(angle);
00612     q1[0] = co;
00613     q1[1] = n[0] * si;
00614     q1[2] = n[1] * si;
00615     q1[3] = 0.0f;
00616 
00617     /* rotate back line v1-v2 */
00618     quat_to_mat3(mat, q1);
00619     invert_m3_m3(imat, mat);
00620     sub_v3_v3v3(vec, v2, v1);
00621     mul_m3_v3(imat, vec);
00622 
00623     /* what angle has this line with x-axis? */
00624     vec[2] = 0.0f;
00625     normalize_v3(vec);
00626 
00627     angle = (float)(0.5 * atan2(vec[1], vec[0]));
00628     co = (float)cos(angle);
00629     si = (float)sin(angle);
00630     q2[0] = co;
00631     q2[1] = 0.0f;
00632     q2[2] = 0.0f;
00633     q2[3] = si;
00634 
00635     mul_qt_qtqt(quat, q1, q2);
00636 }
00637 
00638 void print_qt(const char *str, const float q[4])
00639 {
00640     printf("%s: %.3f %.3f %.3f %.3f\n", str, q[0], q[1], q[2], q[3]);
00641 }
00642 
00643 /******************************** Axis Angle *********************************/
00644 
00645 /* Axis angle to Quaternions */
00646 void axis_angle_to_quat(float q[4], const float axis[3], float angle)
00647 {
00648     float nor[3];
00649     float si;
00650 
00651     if (normalize_v3_v3(nor, axis) == 0.0f) {
00652         unit_qt(q);
00653         return;
00654     }
00655 
00656     angle /= 2;
00657     si = (float)sin(angle);
00658     q[0] = (float)cos(angle);
00659     q[1] = nor[0] * si;
00660     q[2] = nor[1] * si;
00661     q[3] = nor[2] * si;
00662 }
00663 
00664 /* Quaternions to Axis Angle */
00665 void quat_to_axis_angle(float axis[3], float *angle, const float q[4])
00666 {
00667     float ha, si;
00668 
00669 #ifdef DEBUG
00670     if (!((ha = dot_qtqt(q, q)) == 0.0f || (fabsf(ha - 1.0f) < (float)QUAT_EPSILON))) {
00671         fprintf(stderr, "Warning! quat_to_axis_angle() called with non-normalized: size %.8f *** report a bug ***\n", ha);
00672     }
00673 #endif
00674 
00675     /* calculate angle/2, and sin(angle/2) */
00676     ha = (float)acos(q[0]);
00677     si = (float)sin(ha);
00678 
00679     /* from half-angle to angle */
00680     *angle = ha * 2;
00681 
00682     /* prevent division by zero for axis conversion */
00683     if (fabs(si) < 0.0005)
00684         si = 1.0f;
00685 
00686     axis[0] = q[1] / si;
00687     axis[1] = q[2] / si;
00688     axis[2] = q[3] / si;
00689 }
00690 
00691 /* Axis Angle to Euler Rotation */
00692 void axis_angle_to_eulO(float eul[3], const short order, const float axis[3], const float angle)
00693 {
00694     float q[4];
00695 
00696     /* use quaternions as intermediate representation for now... */
00697     axis_angle_to_quat(q, axis, angle);
00698     quat_to_eulO(eul, order, q);
00699 }
00700 
00701 /* Euler Rotation to Axis Angle */
00702 void eulO_to_axis_angle(float axis[3], float *angle, const float eul[3], const short order)
00703 {
00704     float q[4];
00705 
00706     /* use quaternions as intermediate representation for now... */
00707     eulO_to_quat(q, eul, order);
00708     quat_to_axis_angle(axis, angle, q);
00709 }
00710 
00711 /* axis angle to 3x3 matrix - safer version (normalization of axis performed)
00712  *
00713  * note: we may want a normalized and non normalized version of this function.
00714  */
00715 void axis_angle_to_mat3(float mat[3][3], const float axis[3], const float angle)
00716 {
00717     float nor[3], nsi[3], co, si, ico;
00718 
00719     /* normalize the axis first (to remove unwanted scaling) */
00720     if (normalize_v3_v3(nor, axis) == 0.0f) {
00721         unit_m3(mat);
00722         return;
00723     }
00724 
00725     /* now convert this to a 3x3 matrix */
00726     co = (float)cos(angle);
00727     si = (float)sin(angle);
00728 
00729     ico = (1.0f - co);
00730     nsi[0] = nor[0] * si;
00731     nsi[1] = nor[1] * si;
00732     nsi[2] = nor[2] * si;
00733 
00734     mat[0][0] = ((nor[0] * nor[0]) * ico) + co;
00735     mat[0][1] = ((nor[0] * nor[1]) * ico) + nsi[2];
00736     mat[0][2] = ((nor[0] * nor[2]) * ico) - nsi[1];
00737     mat[1][0] = ((nor[0] * nor[1]) * ico) - nsi[2];
00738     mat[1][1] = ((nor[1] * nor[1]) * ico) + co;
00739     mat[1][2] = ((nor[1] * nor[2]) * ico) + nsi[0];
00740     mat[2][0] = ((nor[0] * nor[2]) * ico) + nsi[1];
00741     mat[2][1] = ((nor[1] * nor[2]) * ico) - nsi[0];
00742     mat[2][2] = ((nor[2] * nor[2]) * ico) + co;
00743 }
00744 
00745 /* axis angle to 4x4 matrix - safer version (normalization of axis performed) */
00746 void axis_angle_to_mat4(float mat[4][4], const float axis[3], const float angle)
00747 {
00748     float tmat[3][3];
00749 
00750     axis_angle_to_mat3(tmat, axis, angle);
00751     unit_m4(mat);
00752     copy_m4_m3(mat, tmat);
00753 }
00754 
00755 /* 3x3 matrix to axis angle (see Mat4ToVecRot too) */
00756 void mat3_to_axis_angle(float axis[3], float *angle, float mat[3][3])
00757 {
00758     float q[4];
00759 
00760     /* use quaternions as intermediate representation */
00761     // TODO: it would be nicer to go straight there...
00762     mat3_to_quat(q, mat);
00763     quat_to_axis_angle(axis, angle, q);
00764 }
00765 
00766 /* 4x4 matrix to axis angle (see Mat4ToVecRot too) */
00767 void mat4_to_axis_angle(float axis[3], float *angle, float mat[4][4])
00768 {
00769     float q[4];
00770 
00771     /* use quaternions as intermediate representation */
00772     // TODO: it would be nicer to go straight there...
00773     mat4_to_quat(q, mat);
00774     quat_to_axis_angle(axis, angle, q);
00775 }
00776 
00777 void single_axis_angle_to_mat3(float mat[3][3], const char axis, const float angle)
00778 {
00779     const float angle_cos = cosf(angle);
00780     const float angle_sin = sinf(angle);
00781 
00782     switch (axis) {
00783         case 'X': /* rotation around X */
00784             mat[0][0] = 1.0f;
00785             mat[0][1] = 0.0f;
00786             mat[0][2] = 0.0f;
00787             mat[1][0] = 0.0f;
00788             mat[1][1] = angle_cos;
00789             mat[1][2] = angle_sin;
00790             mat[2][0] = 0.0f;
00791             mat[2][1] = -angle_sin;
00792             mat[2][2] = angle_cos;
00793             break;
00794         case 'Y': /* rotation around Y */
00795             mat[0][0] = angle_cos;
00796             mat[0][1] = 0.0f;
00797             mat[0][2] = -angle_sin;
00798             mat[1][0] = 0.0f;
00799             mat[1][1] = 1.0f;
00800             mat[1][2] = 0.0f;
00801             mat[2][0] = angle_sin;
00802             mat[2][1] = 0.0f;
00803             mat[2][2] = angle_cos;
00804             break;
00805         case 'Z': /* rotation around Z */
00806             mat[0][0] = angle_cos;
00807             mat[0][1] = angle_sin;
00808             mat[0][2] = 0.0f;
00809             mat[1][0] = -angle_sin;
00810             mat[1][1] = angle_cos;
00811             mat[1][2] = 0.0f;
00812             mat[2][0] = 0.0f;
00813             mat[2][1] = 0.0f;
00814             mat[2][2] = 1.0f;
00815             break;
00816         default:
00817             assert(0);
00818     }
00819 }
00820 
00821 /****************************** Vector/Rotation ******************************/
00822 /* TODO: the following calls should probably be depreceated sometime         */
00823 
00824 /* ODO, replace use of this function with axis_angle_to_mat3() */
00825 void vec_rot_to_mat3(float mat[][3], const float vec[3], const float phi)
00826 {
00827     /* rotation of phi radials around vec */
00828     float vx, vx2, vy, vy2, vz, vz2, co, si;
00829 
00830     vx = vec[0];
00831     vy = vec[1];
00832     vz = vec[2];
00833     vx2 = vx * vx;
00834     vy2 = vy * vy;
00835     vz2 = vz * vz;
00836     co = (float)cos(phi);
00837     si = (float)sin(phi);
00838 
00839     mat[0][0] = vx2 + co * (1.0f - vx2);
00840     mat[0][1] = vx * vy * (1.0f - co) + vz * si;
00841     mat[0][2] = vz * vx * (1.0f - co) - vy * si;
00842     mat[1][0] = vx * vy * (1.0f - co) - vz * si;
00843     mat[1][1] = vy2 + co * (1.0f - vy2);
00844     mat[1][2] = vy * vz * (1.0f - co) + vx * si;
00845     mat[2][0] = vz * vx * (1.0f - co) + vy * si;
00846     mat[2][1] = vy * vz * (1.0f - co) - vx * si;
00847     mat[2][2] = vz2 + co * (1.0f - vz2);
00848 }
00849 
00850 /* axis angle to 4x4 matrix */
00851 void vec_rot_to_mat4(float mat[][4], const float vec[3], const float phi)
00852 {
00853     float tmat[3][3];
00854 
00855     vec_rot_to_mat3(tmat, vec, phi);
00856     unit_m4(mat);
00857     copy_m4_m3(mat, tmat);
00858 }
00859 
00860 /* axis angle to quaternion */
00861 void vec_rot_to_quat(float *quat, const float vec[3], const float phi)
00862 {
00863     /* rotation of phi radials around vec */
00864     float si;
00865 
00866     quat[1] = vec[0];
00867     quat[2] = vec[1];
00868     quat[3] = vec[2];
00869 
00870     if (normalize_v3(quat + 1) == 0.0f) {
00871         unit_qt(quat);
00872     }
00873     else {
00874         quat[0] = (float)cos((double)phi / 2.0);
00875         si = (float)sin((double)phi / 2.0);
00876         quat[1] *= si;
00877         quat[2] *= si;
00878         quat[3] *= si;
00879     }
00880 }
00881 
00882 /******************************** XYZ Eulers *********************************/
00883 
00884 /* XYZ order */
00885 void eul_to_mat3(float mat[][3], const float eul[3])
00886 {
00887     double ci, cj, ch, si, sj, sh, cc, cs, sc, ss;
00888 
00889     ci = cos(eul[0]);
00890     cj = cos(eul[1]);
00891     ch = cos(eul[2]);
00892     si = sin(eul[0]);
00893     sj = sin(eul[1]);
00894     sh = sin(eul[2]);
00895     cc = ci * ch;
00896     cs = ci * sh;
00897     sc = si * ch;
00898     ss = si * sh;
00899 
00900     mat[0][0] = (float)(cj * ch);
00901     mat[1][0] = (float)(sj * sc - cs);
00902     mat[2][0] = (float)(sj * cc + ss);
00903     mat[0][1] = (float)(cj * sh);
00904     mat[1][1] = (float)(sj * ss + cc);
00905     mat[2][1] = (float)(sj * cs - sc);
00906     mat[0][2] = (float)-sj;
00907     mat[1][2] = (float)(cj * si);
00908     mat[2][2] = (float)(cj * ci);
00909 
00910 }
00911 
00912 /* XYZ order */
00913 void eul_to_mat4(float mat[][4], const float eul[3])
00914 {
00915     double ci, cj, ch, si, sj, sh, cc, cs, sc, ss;
00916 
00917     ci = cos(eul[0]);
00918     cj = cos(eul[1]);
00919     ch = cos(eul[2]);
00920     si = sin(eul[0]);
00921     sj = sin(eul[1]);
00922     sh = sin(eul[2]);
00923     cc = ci * ch;
00924     cs = ci * sh;
00925     sc = si * ch;
00926     ss = si * sh;
00927 
00928     mat[0][0] = (float)(cj * ch);
00929     mat[1][0] = (float)(sj * sc - cs);
00930     mat[2][0] = (float)(sj * cc + ss);
00931     mat[0][1] = (float)(cj * sh);
00932     mat[1][1] = (float)(sj * ss + cc);
00933     mat[2][1] = (float)(sj * cs - sc);
00934     mat[0][2] = (float)-sj;
00935     mat[1][2] = (float)(cj * si);
00936     mat[2][2] = (float)(cj * ci);
00937 
00938 
00939     mat[3][0] = mat[3][1] = mat[3][2] = mat[0][3] = mat[1][3] = mat[2][3] = 0.0f;
00940     mat[3][3] = 1.0f;
00941 }
00942 
00943 /* returns two euler calculation methods, so we can pick the best */
00944 
00945 /* XYZ order */
00946 static void mat3_to_eul2(float tmat[][3], float eul1[3], float eul2[3])
00947 {
00948     float cy, quat[4], mat[3][3];
00949 
00950     mat3_to_quat(quat, tmat);
00951     quat_to_mat3(mat, quat);
00952     copy_m3_m3(mat, tmat);
00953     normalize_m3(mat);
00954 
00955     cy = (float)sqrt(mat[0][0] * mat[0][0] + mat[0][1] * mat[0][1]);
00956 
00957     if (cy > 16.0f * FLT_EPSILON) {
00958 
00959         eul1[0] = (float)atan2(mat[1][2], mat[2][2]);
00960         eul1[1] = (float)atan2(-mat[0][2], cy);
00961         eul1[2] = (float)atan2(mat[0][1], mat[0][0]);
00962 
00963         eul2[0] = (float)atan2(-mat[1][2], -mat[2][2]);
00964         eul2[1] = (float)atan2(-mat[0][2], -cy);
00965         eul2[2] = (float)atan2(-mat[0][1], -mat[0][0]);
00966 
00967     }
00968     else {
00969         eul1[0] = (float)atan2(-mat[2][1], mat[1][1]);
00970         eul1[1] = (float)atan2(-mat[0][2], cy);
00971         eul1[2] = 0.0f;
00972 
00973         copy_v3_v3(eul2, eul1);
00974     }
00975 }
00976 
00977 /* XYZ order */
00978 void mat3_to_eul(float *eul, float tmat[][3])
00979 {
00980     float eul1[3], eul2[3];
00981 
00982     mat3_to_eul2(tmat, eul1, eul2);
00983 
00984     /* return best, which is just the one with lowest values it in */
00985     if (fabs(eul1[0]) + fabs(eul1[1]) + fabs(eul1[2]) > fabs(eul2[0]) + fabs(eul2[1]) + fabs(eul2[2])) {
00986         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul2);
00987     }
00988     else {
00989         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul1);
00990     }
00991 }
00992 
00993 /* XYZ order */
00994 void mat4_to_eul(float *eul, float tmat[][4])
00995 {
00996     float tempMat[3][3];
00997 
00998     copy_m3_m4(tempMat, tmat);
00999     normalize_m3(tempMat);
01000     mat3_to_eul(eul, tempMat);
01001 }
01002 
01003 /* XYZ order */
01004 void quat_to_eul(float *eul, const float quat[4])
01005 {
01006     float mat[3][3];
01007 
01008     quat_to_mat3(mat, quat);
01009     mat3_to_eul(eul, mat);
01010 }
01011 
01012 /* XYZ order */
01013 void eul_to_quat(float *quat, const float eul[3])
01014 {
01015     float ti, tj, th, ci, cj, ch, si, sj, sh, cc, cs, sc, ss;
01016 
01017     ti = eul[0] * 0.5f;
01018     tj = eul[1] * 0.5f;
01019     th = eul[2] * 0.5f;
01020     ci = cosf(ti);
01021     cj = cosf(tj);
01022     ch = cosf(th);
01023     si = sinf(ti);
01024     sj = sinf(tj);
01025     sh = sinf(th);
01026     cc = ci * ch;
01027     cs = ci * sh;
01028     sc = si * ch;
01029     ss = si * sh;
01030 
01031     quat[0] = cj * cc + sj * ss;
01032     quat[1] = cj * sc - sj * cs;
01033     quat[2] = cj * ss + sj * cc;
01034     quat[3] = cj * cs - sj * sc;
01035 }
01036 
01037 /* XYZ order */
01038 void rotate_eul(float *beul, const char axis, const float ang)
01039 {
01040     float eul[3], mat1[3][3], mat2[3][3], totmat[3][3];
01041 
01042     assert(axis >= 'X' && axis <= 'Z');
01043 
01044     eul[0] = eul[1] = eul[2] = 0.0f;
01045     if (axis == 'X') eul[0] = ang;
01046     else if (axis == 'Y') eul[1] = ang;
01047     else eul[2] = ang;
01048 
01049     eul_to_mat3(mat1, eul);
01050     eul_to_mat3(mat2, beul);
01051 
01052     mul_m3_m3m3(totmat, mat2, mat1);
01053 
01054     mat3_to_eul(beul, totmat);
01055 
01056 }
01057 
01058 /* exported to transform.c */
01059 
01060 /* order independent! */
01061 void compatible_eul(float eul[3], const float oldrot[3])
01062 {
01063     float dx, dy, dz;
01064 
01065     /* correct differences of about 360 degrees first */
01066     dx = eul[0] - oldrot[0];
01067     dy = eul[1] - oldrot[1];
01068     dz = eul[2] - oldrot[2];
01069 
01070     while (fabs(dx) > 5.1) {
01071         if (dx > 0.0f) eul[0] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01072         else eul[0] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01073         dx = eul[0] - oldrot[0];
01074     }
01075     while (fabs(dy) > 5.1) {
01076         if (dy > 0.0f) eul[1] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01077         else eul[1] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01078         dy = eul[1] - oldrot[1];
01079     }
01080     while (fabs(dz) > 5.1) {
01081         if (dz > 0.0f) eul[2] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01082         else eul[2] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01083         dz = eul[2] - oldrot[2];
01084     }
01085 
01086     /* is 1 of the axis rotations larger than 180 degrees and the other small? NO ELSE IF!! */
01087     if (fabs(dx) > 3.2 && fabs(dy) < 1.6 && fabs(dz) < 1.6) {
01088         if (dx > 0.0f) eul[0] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01089         else eul[0] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01090     }
01091     if (fabs(dy) > 3.2 && fabs(dz) < 1.6 && fabs(dx) < 1.6) {
01092         if (dy > 0.0f) eul[1] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01093         else eul[1] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01094     }
01095     if (fabs(dz) > 3.2 && fabs(dx) < 1.6 && fabs(dy) < 1.6) {
01096         if (dz > 0.0f) eul[2] -= 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01097         else eul[2] += 2.0f * (float)M_PI;
01098     }
01099 
01100     /* the method below was there from ancient days... but why! probably because the code sucks :)
01101      */
01102 #if 0
01103     /* calc again */
01104     dx = eul[0] - oldrot[0];
01105     dy = eul[1] - oldrot[1];
01106     dz = eul[2] - oldrot[2];
01107 
01108     /* special case, tested for x-z  */
01109 
01110     if ((fabs(dx) > 3.1 && fabs(dz) > 1.5) || (fabs(dx) > 1.5 && fabs(dz) > 3.1)) {
01111         if (dx > 0.0) eul[0] -= M_PI;
01112         else eul[0] += M_PI;
01113         if (eul[1] > 0.0) eul[1] = M_PI - eul[1];
01114         else eul[1] = -M_PI - eul[1];
01115         if (dz > 0.0) eul[2] -= M_PI;
01116         else eul[2] += M_PI;
01117 
01118     }
01119     else if ((fabs(dx) > 3.1 && fabs(dy) > 1.5) || (fabs(dx) > 1.5 && fabs(dy) > 3.1)) {
01120         if (dx > 0.0) eul[0] -= M_PI;
01121         else eul[0] += M_PI;
01122         if (dy > 0.0) eul[1] -= M_PI;
01123         else eul[1] += M_PI;
01124         if (eul[2] > 0.0) eul[2] = M_PI - eul[2];
01125         else eul[2] = -M_PI - eul[2];
01126     }
01127     else if ((fabs(dy) > 3.1 && fabs(dz) > 1.5) || (fabs(dy) > 1.5 && fabs(dz) > 3.1)) {
01128         if (eul[0] > 0.0) eul[0] = M_PI - eul[0];
01129         else eul[0] = -M_PI - eul[0];
01130         if (dy > 0.0) eul[1] -= M_PI;
01131         else eul[1] += M_PI;
01132         if (dz > 0.0) eul[2] -= M_PI;
01133         else eul[2] += M_PI;
01134     }
01135 #endif
01136 }
01137 
01138 /* uses 2 methods to retrieve eulers, and picks the closest */
01139 
01140 /* XYZ order */
01141 void mat3_to_compatible_eul(float eul[3], const float oldrot[3], float mat[][3])
01142 {
01143     float eul1[3], eul2[3];
01144     float d1, d2;
01145 
01146     mat3_to_eul2(mat, eul1, eul2);
01147 
01148     compatible_eul(eul1, oldrot);
01149     compatible_eul(eul2, oldrot);
01150 
01151     d1 = (float)fabs(eul1[0] - oldrot[0]) + (float)fabs(eul1[1] - oldrot[1]) + (float)fabs(eul1[2] - oldrot[2]);
01152     d2 = (float)fabs(eul2[0] - oldrot[0]) + (float)fabs(eul2[1] - oldrot[1]) + (float)fabs(eul2[2] - oldrot[2]);
01153 
01154     /* return best, which is just the one with lowest difference */
01155     if (d1 > d2) {
01156         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul2);
01157     }
01158     else {
01159         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul1);
01160     }
01161 
01162 }
01163 
01164 /************************** Arbitrary Order Eulers ***************************/
01165 
01166 /* Euler Rotation Order Code:
01167  * was adapted from
01168  *      ANSI C code from the article
01169  *      "Euler Angle Conversion"
01170  *      by Ken Shoemake, shoemake@graphics.cis.upenn.edu
01171  *      in "Graphics Gems IV", Academic Press, 1994
01172  * for use in Blender
01173  */
01174 
01175 /* Type for rotation order info - see wiki for derivation details */
01176 typedef struct RotOrderInfo {
01177     short axis[3];
01178     short parity; /* parity of axis permutation (even=0, odd=1) - 'n' in original code */
01179 } RotOrderInfo;
01180 
01181 /* Array of info for Rotation Order calculations
01182  * WARNING: must be kept in same order as eEulerRotationOrders
01183  */
01184 static RotOrderInfo rotOrders[] = {
01185     /* i, j, k, n */
01186     {{0, 1, 2}, 0}, // XYZ
01187     {{0, 2, 1}, 1}, // XZY
01188     {{1, 0, 2}, 1}, // YXZ
01189     {{1, 2, 0}, 0}, // YZX
01190     {{2, 0, 1}, 0}, // ZXY
01191     {{2, 1, 0}, 1}  // ZYX
01192 };
01193 
01194 /* Get relevant pointer to rotation order set from the array
01195  * NOTE: since we start at 1 for the values, but arrays index from 0,
01196  *       there is -1 factor involved in this process...
01197  */
01198 #define GET_ROTATIONORDER_INFO(order) (assert(order >= 0 && order <= 6), (order < 1) ? &rotOrders[0] : &rotOrders[(order) - 1])
01199 
01200 /* Construct quaternion from Euler angles (in radians). */
01201 void eulO_to_quat(float q[4], const float e[3], const short order)
01202 {
01203     RotOrderInfo *R = GET_ROTATIONORDER_INFO(order);
01204     short i = R->axis[0], j = R->axis[1], k = R->axis[2];
01205     double ti, tj, th, ci, cj, ch, si, sj, sh, cc, cs, sc, ss;
01206     double a[3];
01207 
01208     ti = e[i] * 0.5f;
01209     tj = e[j] * (R->parity ? -0.5f : 0.5f);
01210     th = e[k] * 0.5f;
01211 
01212     ci = cos(ti);
01213     cj = cos(tj);
01214     ch = cos(th);
01215     si = sin(ti);
01216     sj = sin(tj);
01217     sh = sin(th);
01218 
01219     cc = ci * ch;
01220     cs = ci * sh;
01221     sc = si * ch;
01222     ss = si * sh;
01223 
01224     a[i] = cj * sc - sj * cs;
01225     a[j] = cj * ss + sj * cc;
01226     a[k] = cj * cs - sj * sc;
01227 
01228     q[0] = cj * cc + sj * ss;
01229     q[1] = a[0];
01230     q[2] = a[1];
01231     q[3] = a[2];
01232 
01233     if (R->parity) q[j + 1] = -q[j + 1];
01234 }
01235 
01236 /* Convert quaternion to Euler angles (in radians). */
01237 void quat_to_eulO(float e[3], short const order, const float q[4])
01238 {
01239     float M[3][3];
01240 
01241     quat_to_mat3(M, q);
01242     mat3_to_eulO(e, order, M);
01243 }
01244 
01245 /* Construct 3x3 matrix from Euler angles (in radians). */
01246 void eulO_to_mat3(float M[3][3], const float e[3], const short order)
01247 {
01248     RotOrderInfo *R = GET_ROTATIONORDER_INFO(order);
01249     short i = R->axis[0], j = R->axis[1], k = R->axis[2];
01250     double ti, tj, th, ci, cj, ch, si, sj, sh, cc, cs, sc, ss;
01251 
01252     if (R->parity) {
01253         ti = -e[i];
01254         tj = -e[j];
01255         th = -e[k];
01256     }
01257     else {
01258         ti = e[i];
01259         tj = e[j];
01260         th = e[k];
01261     }
01262 
01263     ci = cos(ti);
01264     cj = cos(tj);
01265     ch = cos(th);
01266     si = sin(ti);
01267     sj = sin(tj);
01268     sh = sin(th);
01269 
01270     cc = ci * ch;
01271     cs = ci * sh;
01272     sc = si * ch;
01273     ss = si * sh;
01274 
01275     M[i][i] = cj * ch;
01276     M[j][i] = sj * sc - cs;
01277     M[k][i] = sj * cc + ss;
01278     M[i][j] = cj * sh;
01279     M[j][j] = sj * ss + cc;
01280     M[k][j] = sj * cs - sc;
01281     M[i][k] = -sj;
01282     M[j][k] = cj * si;
01283     M[k][k] = cj * ci;
01284 }
01285 
01286 /* returns two euler calculation methods, so we can pick the best */
01287 static void mat3_to_eulo2(float M[3][3], float *e1, float *e2, short order)
01288 {
01289     RotOrderInfo *R = GET_ROTATIONORDER_INFO(order);
01290     short i = R->axis[0], j = R->axis[1], k = R->axis[2];
01291     float m[3][3];
01292     double cy;
01293 
01294     /* process the matrix first */
01295     copy_m3_m3(m, M);
01296     normalize_m3(m);
01297 
01298     cy = sqrt(m[i][i] * m[i][i] + m[i][j] * m[i][j]);
01299 
01300     if (cy > 16.0 * (double)FLT_EPSILON) {
01301         e1[i] = atan2(m[j][k], m[k][k]);
01302         e1[j] = atan2(-m[i][k], cy);
01303         e1[k] = atan2(m[i][j], m[i][i]);
01304 
01305         e2[i] = atan2(-m[j][k], -m[k][k]);
01306         e2[j] = atan2(-m[i][k], -cy);
01307         e2[k] = atan2(-m[i][j], -m[i][i]);
01308     }
01309     else {
01310         e1[i] = atan2(-m[k][j], m[j][j]);
01311         e1[j] = atan2(-m[i][k], cy);
01312         e1[k] = 0;
01313 
01314         copy_v3_v3(e2, e1);
01315     }
01316 
01317     if (R->parity) {
01318         e1[0] = -e1[0];
01319         e1[1] = -e1[1];
01320         e1[2] = -e1[2];
01321 
01322         e2[0] = -e2[0];
01323         e2[1] = -e2[1];
01324         e2[2] = -e2[2];
01325     }
01326 }
01327 
01328 /* Construct 4x4 matrix from Euler angles (in radians). */
01329 void eulO_to_mat4(float M[4][4], const float e[3], const short order)
01330 {
01331     float m[3][3];
01332 
01333     /* for now, we'll just do this the slow way (i.e. copying matrices) */
01334     normalize_m3(m);
01335     eulO_to_mat3(m, e, order);
01336     copy_m4_m3(M, m);
01337 }
01338 
01339 /* Convert 3x3 matrix to Euler angles (in radians). */
01340 void mat3_to_eulO(float eul[3], const short order, float M[3][3])
01341 {
01342     float eul1[3], eul2[3];
01343 
01344     mat3_to_eulo2(M, eul1, eul2, order);
01345 
01346     /* return best, which is just the one with lowest values it in */
01347     if (fabs(eul1[0]) + fabs(eul1[1]) + fabs(eul1[2]) > fabs(eul2[0]) + fabs(eul2[1]) + fabs(eul2[2])) {
01348         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul2);
01349     }
01350     else {
01351         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul1);
01352     }
01353 }
01354 
01355 /* Convert 4x4 matrix to Euler angles (in radians). */
01356 void mat4_to_eulO(float e[3], const short order, float M[4][4])
01357 {
01358     float m[3][3];
01359 
01360     /* for now, we'll just do this the slow way (i.e. copying matrices) */
01361     copy_m3_m4(m, M);
01362     normalize_m3(m);
01363     mat3_to_eulO(e, order, m);
01364 }
01365 
01366 /* uses 2 methods to retrieve eulers, and picks the closest */
01367 void mat3_to_compatible_eulO(float eul[3], float oldrot[3], short order, float mat[3][3])
01368 {
01369     float eul1[3], eul2[3];
01370     float d1, d2;
01371 
01372     mat3_to_eulo2(mat, eul1, eul2, order);
01373 
01374     compatible_eul(eul1, oldrot);
01375     compatible_eul(eul2, oldrot);
01376 
01377     d1 = fabsf(eul1[0] - oldrot[0]) + fabsf(eul1[1] - oldrot[1]) + fabsf(eul1[2] - oldrot[2]);
01378     d2 = fabsf(eul2[0] - oldrot[0]) + fabsf(eul2[1] - oldrot[1]) + fabsf(eul2[2] - oldrot[2]);
01379 
01380     /* return best, which is just the one with lowest difference */
01381     if (d1 > d2)
01382         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul2);
01383     else
01384         copy_v3_v3(eul, eul1);
01385 }
01386 
01387 void mat4_to_compatible_eulO(float eul[3], float oldrot[3], short order, float M[4][4])
01388 {
01389     float m[3][3];
01390 
01391     /* for now, we'll just do this the slow way (i.e. copying matrices) */
01392     copy_m3_m4(m, M);
01393     normalize_m3(m);
01394     mat3_to_compatible_eulO(eul, oldrot, order, m);
01395 }
01396 /* rotate the given euler by the given angle on the specified axis */
01397 // NOTE: is this safe to do with different axis orders?
01398 
01399 void rotate_eulO(float beul[3], short order, char axis, float ang)
01400 {
01401     float eul[3], mat1[3][3], mat2[3][3], totmat[3][3];
01402 
01403     assert(axis >= 'X' && axis <= 'Z');
01404 
01405     eul[0] = eul[1] = eul[2] = 0.0f;
01406     if (axis == 'X')
01407         eul[0] = ang;
01408     else if (axis == 'Y')
01409         eul[1] = ang;
01410     else
01411         eul[2] = ang;
01412 
01413     eulO_to_mat3(mat1, eul, order);
01414     eulO_to_mat3(mat2, beul, order);
01415 
01416     mul_m3_m3m3(totmat, mat2, mat1);
01417 
01418     mat3_to_eulO(beul, order, totmat);
01419 }
01420 
01421 /* the matrix is written to as 3 axis vectors */
01422 void eulO_to_gimbal_axis(float gmat[][3], const float eul[3], const short order)
01423 {
01424     RotOrderInfo *R = GET_ROTATIONORDER_INFO(order);
01425 
01426     float mat[3][3];
01427     float teul[3];
01428 
01429     /* first axis is local */
01430     eulO_to_mat3(mat, eul, order);
01431     copy_v3_v3(gmat[R->axis[0]], mat[R->axis[0]]);
01432 
01433     /* second axis is local minus first rotation */
01434     copy_v3_v3(teul, eul);
01435     teul[R->axis[0]] = 0;
01436     eulO_to_mat3(mat, teul, order);
01437     copy_v3_v3(gmat[R->axis[1]], mat[R->axis[1]]);
01438 
01439 
01440     /* Last axis is global */
01441     gmat[R->axis[2]][0] = 0;
01442     gmat[R->axis[2]][1] = 0;
01443     gmat[R->axis[2]][2] = 0;
01444     gmat[R->axis[2]][R->axis[2]] = 1;
01445 }
01446 
01447 /******************************* Dual Quaternions ****************************/
01448 
01481 void mat4_to_dquat(DualQuat *dq, float basemat[][4], float mat[][4])
01482 {
01483     float *t, *q, dscale[3], scale[3], basequat[4];
01484     float baseRS[4][4], baseinv[4][4], baseR[4][4], baseRinv[4][4];
01485     float R[4][4], S[4][4];
01486 
01487     /* split scaling and rotation, there is probably a faster way to do
01488      * this, it's done like this now to correctly get negative scaling */
01489     mult_m4_m4m4(baseRS, mat, basemat);
01490     mat4_to_size(scale, baseRS);
01491 
01492     copy_v3_v3(dscale, scale);
01493     dscale[0] -= 1.0f;
01494     dscale[1] -= 1.0f;
01495     dscale[2] -= 1.0f;
01496 
01497     if ((determinant_m4(mat) < 0.0f) || len_v3(dscale) > 1e-4f) {
01498         /* extract R and S  */
01499         float tmp[4][4];
01500 
01501         /* extra orthogonalize, to avoid flipping with stretched bones */
01502         copy_m4_m4(tmp, baseRS);
01503         orthogonalize_m4(tmp, 1);
01504         mat4_to_quat(basequat, tmp);
01505 
01506         quat_to_mat4(baseR, basequat);
01507         copy_v3_v3(baseR[3], baseRS[3]);
01508 
01509         invert_m4_m4(baseinv, basemat);
01510         mult_m4_m4m4(R, baseR, baseinv);
01511 
01512         invert_m4_m4(baseRinv, baseR);
01513         mult_m4_m4m4(S, baseRinv, baseRS);
01514 
01515         /* set scaling part */
01516         mul_serie_m4(dq->scale, basemat, S, baseinv, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01517         dq->scale_weight = 1.0f;
01518     }
01519     else {
01520         /* matrix does not contain scaling */
01521         copy_m4_m4(R, mat);
01522         dq->scale_weight = 0.0f;
01523     }
01524 
01525     /* non-dual part */
01526     mat4_to_quat(dq->quat, R);
01527 
01528     /* dual part */
01529     t = R[3];
01530     q = dq->quat;
01531     dq->trans[0] = -0.5f * (t[0] * q[1] + t[1] * q[2] + t[2] * q[3]);
01532     dq->trans[1] = 0.5f * (t[0] * q[0] + t[1] * q[3] - t[2] * q[2]);
01533     dq->trans[2] = 0.5f * (-t[0] * q[3] + t[1] * q[0] + t[2] * q[1]);
01534     dq->trans[3] = 0.5f * (t[0] * q[2] - t[1] * q[1] + t[2] * q[0]);
01535 }
01536 
01537 void dquat_to_mat4(float mat[][4], DualQuat *dq)
01538 {
01539     float len, *t, q0[4];
01540 
01541     /* regular quaternion */
01542     copy_qt_qt(q0, dq->quat);
01543 
01544     /* normalize */
01545     len = (float)sqrt(dot_qtqt(q0, q0));
01546     if (len != 0.0f)
01547         mul_qt_fl(q0, 1.0f / len);
01548 
01549     /* rotation */
01550     quat_to_mat4(mat, q0);
01551 
01552     /* translation */
01553     t = dq->trans;
01554     mat[3][0] = 2.0f * (-t[0] * q0[1] + t[1] * q0[0] - t[2] * q0[3] + t[3] * q0[2]);
01555     mat[3][1] = 2.0f * (-t[0] * q0[2] + t[1] * q0[3] + t[2] * q0[0] - t[3] * q0[1]);
01556     mat[3][2] = 2.0f * (-t[0] * q0[3] - t[1] * q0[2] + t[2] * q0[1] + t[3] * q0[0]);
01557 
01558     /* note: this does not handle scaling */
01559 }
01560 
01561 void add_weighted_dq_dq(DualQuat *dqsum, DualQuat *dq, float weight)
01562 {
01563     int flipped = 0;
01564 
01565     /* make sure we interpolate quats in the right direction */
01566     if (dot_qtqt(dq->quat, dqsum->quat) < 0) {
01567         flipped = 1;
01568         weight = -weight;
01569     }
01570 
01571     /* interpolate rotation and translation */
01572     dqsum->quat[0] += weight * dq->quat[0];
01573     dqsum->quat[1] += weight * dq->quat[1];
01574     dqsum->quat[2] += weight * dq->quat[2];
01575     dqsum->quat[3] += weight * dq->quat[3];
01576 
01577     dqsum->trans[0] += weight * dq->trans[0];
01578     dqsum->trans[1] += weight * dq->trans[1];
01579     dqsum->trans[2] += weight * dq->trans[2];
01580     dqsum->trans[3] += weight * dq->trans[3];
01581 
01582     /* interpolate scale - but only if needed */
01583     if (dq->scale_weight) {
01584         float wmat[4][4];
01585 
01586         if (flipped) /* we don't want negative weights for scaling */
01587             weight = -weight;
01588 
01589         copy_m4_m4(wmat, dq->scale);
01590         mul_m4_fl(wmat, weight);
01591         add_m4_m4m4(dqsum->scale, dqsum->scale, wmat);
01592         dqsum->scale_weight += weight;
01593     }
01594 }
01595 
01596 void normalize_dq(DualQuat *dq, float totweight)
01597 {
01598     float scale = 1.0f / totweight;
01599 
01600     mul_qt_fl(dq->quat, scale);
01601     mul_qt_fl(dq->trans, scale);
01602 
01603     if (dq->scale_weight) {
01604         float addweight = totweight - dq->scale_weight;
01605 
01606         if (addweight) {
01607             dq->scale[0][0] += addweight;
01608             dq->scale[1][1] += addweight;
01609             dq->scale[2][2] += addweight;
01610             dq->scale[3][3] += addweight;
01611         }
01612 
01613         mul_m4_fl(dq->scale, scale);
01614         dq->scale_weight = 1.0f;
01615     }
01616 }
01617 
01618 void mul_v3m3_dq(float *co, float mat[][3], DualQuat *dq)
01619 {
01620     float M[3][3], t[3], scalemat[3][3], len2;
01621     float w = dq->quat[0], x = dq->quat[1], y = dq->quat[2], z = dq->quat[3];
01622     float t0 = dq->trans[0], t1 = dq->trans[1], t2 = dq->trans[2], t3 = dq->trans[3];
01623 
01624     /* rotation matrix */
01625     M[0][0] = w * w + x * x - y * y - z * z;
01626     M[1][0] = 2 * (x * y - w * z);
01627     M[2][0] = 2 * (x * z + w * y);
01628 
01629     M[0][1] = 2 * (x * y + w * z);
01630     M[1][1] = w * w + y * y - x * x - z * z;
01631     M[2][1] = 2 * (y * z - w * x);
01632 
01633     M[0][2] = 2 * (x * z - w * y);
01634     M[1][2] = 2 * (y * z + w * x);
01635     M[2][2] = w * w + z * z - x * x - y * y;
01636 
01637     len2 = dot_qtqt(dq->quat, dq->quat);
01638     if (len2 > 0.0f)
01639         len2 = 1.0f / len2;
01640 
01641     /* translation */
01642     t[0] = 2 * (-t0 * x + w * t1 - t2 * z + y * t3);
01643     t[1] = 2 * (-t0 * y + t1 * z - x * t3 + w * t2);
01644     t[2] = 2 * (-t0 * z + x * t2 + w * t3 - t1 * y);
01645 
01646     /* apply scaling */
01647     if (dq->scale_weight)
01648         mul_m4_v3(dq->scale, co);
01649 
01650     /* apply rotation and translation */
01651     mul_m3_v3(M, co);
01652     co[0] = (co[0] + t[0]) * len2;
01653     co[1] = (co[1] + t[1]) * len2;
01654     co[2] = (co[2] + t[2]) * len2;
01655 
01656     /* compute crazyspace correction mat */
01657     if (mat) {
01658         if (dq->scale_weight) {
01659             copy_m3_m4(scalemat, dq->scale);
01660             mul_m3_m3m3(mat, M, scalemat);
01661         }
01662         else
01663             copy_m3_m3(mat, M);
01664         mul_m3_fl(mat, len2);
01665     }
01666 }
01667 
01668 void copy_dq_dq(DualQuat *dq1, DualQuat *dq2)
01669 {
01670     memcpy(dq1, dq2, sizeof(DualQuat));
01671 }
01672 
01673 /* axis matches eTrackToAxis_Modes */
01674 void quat_apply_track(float quat[4], short axis, short upflag)
01675 {
01676     /* rotations are hard coded to match vec_to_quat */
01677     const float quat_track[][4] = {
01678         {0.70710676908493, 0.0, -0.70710676908493, 0.0}, /* pos-y90 */
01679         {0.5, 0.5, 0.5, 0.5}, /* Quaternion((1,0,0), radians(90)) * Quaternion((0,1,0), radians(90)) */
01680         {0.70710676908493, 0.0, 0.0, 0.70710676908493}, /* pos-z90 */
01681         {0.70710676908493, 0.0, 0.70710676908493, 0.0}, /* neg-y90 */
01682         {0.5, -0.5, -0.5, 0.5}, /* Quaternion((1,0,0), radians(-90)) * Quaternion((0,1,0), radians(-90)) */
01683         {-3.0908619663705394e-08, 0.70710676908493, 0.70710676908493, 3.0908619663705394e-08}}; /* no rotation */
01684 
01685     assert(axis >= 0 && axis <= 5);
01686     assert(upflag >= 0 && upflag <= 2);
01687 
01688     mul_qt_qtqt(quat, quat, quat_track[axis]);
01689 
01690     if (axis > 2)
01691         axis = axis - 3;
01692 
01693     /* there are 2 possible up-axis for each axis used, the 'quat_track' applies so the first
01694      * up axis is used X->Y, Y->X, Z->X, if this first up axis isn used then rotate 90d
01695      * the strange bit shift below just find the low axis {X:Y, Y:X, Z:X} */
01696     if (upflag != (2 - axis) >> 1) {
01697         float q[4] = {0.70710676908493, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0}; /* assign 90d rotation axis */
01698         q[axis + 1] = ((axis == 1)) ? 0.70710676908493 : -0.70710676908493; /* flip non Y axis */
01699         mul_qt_qtqt(quat, quat, q);
01700     }
01701 }
01702 
01703 void vec_apply_track(float vec[3], short axis)
01704 {
01705     float tvec[3];
01706 
01707     assert(axis >= 0 && axis <= 5);
01708 
01709     copy_v3_v3(tvec, vec);
01710 
01711     switch (axis) {
01712         case 0: /* pos-x */
01713             /* vec[0]=  0.0; */
01714             vec[1] = tvec[2];
01715             vec[2] = -tvec[1];
01716             break;
01717         case 1: /* pos-y */
01718             /* vec[0]= tvec[0]; */
01719             /* vec[1]=  0.0; */
01720             /* vec[2]= tvec[2]; */
01721             break;
01722         case 2: /* pos-z */
01723             /* vec[0]= tvec[0]; */
01724             /* vec[1]= tvec[1]; */
01725             // vec[2]=  0.0; */
01726             break;
01727         case 3: /* neg-x */
01728             /* vec[0]=  0.0; */
01729             vec[1] = tvec[2];
01730             vec[2] = -tvec[1];
01731             break;
01732         case 4: /* neg-y */
01733             vec[0] = -tvec[2];
01734             /* vec[1]=  0.0; */
01735             vec[2] = tvec[0];
01736             break;
01737         case 5: /* neg-z */
01738             vec[0] = -tvec[0];
01739             vec[1] = -tvec[1];
01740             /* vec[2]=  0.0; */
01741             break;
01742     }
01743 }
01744 
01745 /* lens/angle conversion (radians) */
01746 float focallength_to_fov(float focal_length, float sensor)
01747 {
01748     return 2.0f * atanf((sensor / 2.0f) / focal_length);
01749 }
01750 
01751 float fov_to_focallength(float hfov, float sensor)
01752 {
01753     return (sensor / 2.0f) / tanf(hfov * 0.5f);
01754 }
01755 
01756 /* 'mod_inline(-3,4)= 1', 'fmod(-3,4)= -3' */
01757 static float mod_inline(float a, float b)
01758 {
01759     return a - (b * floorf(a / b));
01760 }
01761 
01762 float angle_wrap_rad(float angle)
01763 {
01764     return mod_inline(angle + (float)M_PI, (float)M_PI * 2.0f) - (float)M_PI;
01765 }
01766 
01767 float angle_wrap_deg(float angle)
01768 {
01769     return mod_inline(angle + 180.0f, 360.0f) - 180.0f;
01770 }
